Accountability is often confused with ownership and it gets slightly tricky. 

One may feel ownership but those who are accountable of their actions getting to the finish line get to own more.

I found most accountable are self managed and they have their own reliable system.

Using https://t.co/JhZMkIunyx for global payments and management for teams outside US
Doubled bonusly points for team to acknowledge each other more in a remote environment
In the end humans need connection for intellectual stimulations. The hybrid approach may create gaps and the mindset remote-first makes hybrid more enjoyable.
We still get together in person at office and do offsite but operating  as a fully remote has its advantages to tools, systems, processes, communication, etc.
More communication is written down because consumption is across the time zones.
Embedding DEI as foundation in a remote first environment beyond physical spaces
Standardized slack channels and organized freelancers into multi channel guests for consistency.

Tightened the SDLC, Asana for process, PR reviews.
Deployed smaller scrums organized in slack channels across global teams.
Adopted to huddle in slack.
Deployed wellness best practices for consistency around core and non core flexible hours so the expectations and time zones are respected.
Got Trinet as PEO going to strengthen on health benefits as many families getting impacted with covid.
We deployed teamable for more recurring feedback mechanism, also completely integrated in slack. We are still testing this but it‚Äôs helping not have to wait for offsite in person to give feedback.
We deployed geekbot for standups that everyone in company follows. We have developers all around the globe, it worked great to have a consistent mechanism for standups instead of just standup calls.
Luckily we discussed what we could do. Following many ODS companies we decided to bootstrap fully as remote company despite a few come together to office.

The space helps as a common means to fulfill the need of in person conversations. 4-6 consistently showed up. This while strengthened some areas, relationships with this who were remote stayed flat as those coffee talks were not happening.
During dec 2020 as we wrapped seed round, secured a beautiful small space with a 40% discount on price. It was good deal. This gave us a space for all of us to gather for company gatherings.

Year 1 we were just a small group of 5-6 people mostly developing tech and narrative working from our homes. 
Although myself and my co founder @SharonZhang_AI ended up working together from a co working space.
Our startup is operating hybrid but we are now fully equipped with global / remote optimized tools. Journey, process and tools for startups in the same boat.
